00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements the list of known variables and their types
00004 #
00005 package Parser::Context::Variables;
00006 use strict;
00007 our @ISA = qw(Value::Context::Data);
00008 
00009 #
00010 #  The named types for variables
00011 #    (you can use arbitary types by supplying an
00012 #     instance of the type rather than a name)
00013 #
00014 our %type = (
00015   'Real'    => $Value::Type{number},
00016   'Complex' => $Value::Type{complex},
00017   'Point2D' => Value::Type('Point',2,$Value::Type{number}),
00018   'Point3D' => Value::Type('Point',3,$Value::Type{number}),
00019   'Vector2D' => Value::Type('Vector',2,$Value::Type{number}),
00020   'Vector3D' => Value::Type('Vector',3,$Value::Type{number}),
00021   'Parameter' => $Value::Type{number},
00022 );
00023 
00024 sub init {
00025   my $self = shift;
00026   $self->{dataName} = 'variables';
00027   $self->{name} = 'variable';
00028   $self->{Name} = 'Variable';
00029   $self->{namePattern} = qr/[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9]*/;
00030   $self->{tokenType} = 'var';
00031   $self->{precedence} = 5;
00032   $self->{patterns}{$self->{namePattern}} = [$self->{precedence},$self->{tokenType}];
00033 }
00034 
00035 #sub addToken {}    # no tokens needed
00036 #sub removeToken {}
00037 
00038 #
00039 #  If the type is one of the names ones, use it's known type
00040 #  Otherwise if it is a Value object use its type,
00041 #  Otherwise, if it is a signed number, use the Real type
00042 #  Otherwise report an error
00043 #
00044 sub create {
00045   my $self = shift; my $value = shift; my @extra;
00046   return $value if ref($value) eq 'HASH';
00047   ($value,@extra) = @{$value} if ref($value) eq 'ARRAY';
00048   if (defined($type{$value})) {
00049     push(@extra,(parameter => 1)) if $value eq 'Parameter';
00050     $value = $type{$value};
00051   } elsif (Value::isValue($value)) {
00052     $value = $value->typeRef;
00053   } elsif ($value =~ m/$self->{context}{pattern}{signedNumber}/) {
00054     $value = $type{'Real'};
00055   } else {
00056     Value::Error("Unrecognized variable type '%s'",$value);
00057   }
00058   return {type => $value, @extra};
00059 }
00060 sub uncreate {shift; (shift)->{type}};
00061 
00062 #
00063 #  Return a variable's type
00064 #
00065 sub type {
00066   my $self = shift; my $x = shift;
00067   return $self->{context}{variables}{$x}{type};
00068 }
00069 
00070 #
00071 #  Return a parameter's value
00072 #
00073 sub value {
00074   my $self = shift; my $x = shift;
00075   return $self->{context}{variables}{$x}{value};
00076 }
00077 
00078 #
00079 #  Get the names of all variables
00080 #
00081 sub variables {
00082   my $self = shift; my @names;
00083   foreach my $x ($self->SUPER::names)
00084     {push(@names,$x) unless $self->{context}{variables}{$x}{parameter}}
00085   return @names;
00086 }
00087 
00088 #
00089 #  Get the names of all parameters
00090 #
00091 sub parameters {
00092   my $self = shift; my @names;
00093   foreach my $x ($self->SUPER::names)
00094     {push(@names,$x) if $self->{context}{variables}{$x}{parameter}}
00095   return @names;
00096 }

00100 1;
